article.headline: Rider 76, Drexel 71
article.story: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J. (AP) -- Jerry Johnson had 19 points and six assists to lead Rider past Drexel 76-71 on Saturday. Rider broke open a close game with a 15-4 run early in the second half and then held off a late Drexel rally. Johnson, who hit all 11 of his free throws, and Edwin Muniz each had five points for the Broncs (1-1) during the run. Muniz finished with 18 points and seven rebounds, while Steve Castleberry added 15 points and six rebounds for Rider. Drexel narrowed the Broncs lead to 71-69 with just over two minutes to play, but the Dragons (0-2) would not get any closer. Drexel got 15 points and a game-high eight rebounds from Phil Goss, while Jeremiah King came off the bench to add 15 points.
